other_tests.findings: The pancreas is homogeneously enhancing. Diffuse edema is noted within the retroperitoneum and in the anterior pararenal space. No pseudocyst or splenic vein thrombosis is noted. The liver, spleen, adrenal glands have normal appearance. The duodenum contains a diverticulum which arises from the third portion and abuts the CBD posteriorly and pancreatic duct laterally. Common bile duct is normal in size and appearance with no stones. There is a 10-mm stone within the gallbladder neck. No pathologically enlarged lymphadenopathy or free fluid is noted.
